intro: Mastixia trichotoma var. laxa, commonly known as the slender mastixia, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Thailand and Malaysia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is adapted to humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests or secondary growth areas.
